items.name: Mrs. Wang

items.name: Chen Family

items.name: Rodriguez Family
items.content: Medicare covered everything. We didn't have to worry about costs and could focus on spending quality time together during those precious final months.

hero.title: Resources & Answers
hero.description: Find comprehensive information about hospice care, insurance coverage, eligibility requirements, and helpful resources for families during this important time.

faq.title: Comprehensive
faq.description: Detailed answers to the questions families ask most about hospice care, eligibility, and what to expect from our services.

payment.question: Who pays for hospice care and what costs are covered?
payment.answer: Medicare, Medi-Cal, and most HMO and private insurance plans cover hospice services up to 100%. This includes all medical equipment, medications related to the terminal diagnosis, nursing care, and support services. We handle all insurance paperwork and authorization processes for you.
payment.note: We verify coverage before starting care and will never surprise you with unexpected costs.

eligibility.question: How does someone qualify for hospice care?
eligibility.answer: A physician must determine that a patient has a terminal prognosis of six months or less if the disease runs its normal course, and the patient's functional status is declining. We work closely with your doctor to assess eligibility.

conditions.heart: Heart disease and circulatory conditions (heart failure, etc.)

location.question: Where can hospice care be provided?
location.answer: We provide care wherever you call home - your own residence, skilled nursing facilities, assisted living communities, board and care facilities, hospitals, or long-term care facilities. Our goal is to ensure comfort in your chosen environment.

services.question: What specific services are included in hospice care?
services.answer: Our comprehensive hospice care includes all medical services, equipment, and support needed for comfort care:

family.question: How does hospice care support family members?
family.answer: We provide comprehensive family support including grief counseling, respite care, family education and training, spiritual counseling, and bereavement services that continue for 13 months after your loved one's passing. Our team is available 24/7 to support both patients and families.

resources.title: Educational
resources.description: Download helpful guides, forms, and educational materials to better understand hospice care and support your family through this journey.

guide.title: Hospice Care Guide
guide.description: Comprehensive guide explaining hospice philosophy, services, and what families can expect.

family.title: Family Support Handbook
family.description: Resources for family caregivers, including self-care tips and grief support information.

forms.title: Important Forms
forms.description: Intake forms, advance directives, and other important documents for hospice care.

community.title: Connect With Our
community.description: Follow us on social media for updates, educational content, and connection with other families in our community.

facebook.title: Facebook Page
facebook.description: Get updates, educational content, and connect with our hospice care community.

chinese.title: Chinese Community
chinese.description: Connect with Chinese-speaking families and access resources in your language.

cta.title: Still Have Questions?
cta.description: Our compassionate team is here to answer any questions you may have about hospice care and help guide you through this important decision.

hero.title: Living with Comfort,
hero.description: Hospice care is not about giving up hope - it's about changing the focus from cure to comfort, ensuring that life's final chapter is lived with dignity, peace, and surrounded by love.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy of Care
philosophy.description: Hospice care is not giving up. When all treatment options have been exhausted or methods are no longer effective, hospice care provides another way for patients to live comfortably, peacefully, and with dignity without curative care.
philosophy.additional: We believe that every person deserves to live their final days with dignity, comfort, and in the presence of their loved ones. Our approach focuses on enhancing quality of life, managing symptoms, and providing emotional and spiritual support.

comfort.title: Comfort-Focused Care
comfort.description: Prioritizing pain relief and symptom management to ensure maximum comfort and quality of life.

dignity.title: Preserving Dignity
dignity.description: Respecting patient autonomy, personal values, and maintaining dignity throughout the care process.

peace.title: Creating Peace
peace.description: Fostering an environment of tranquility, understanding, and emotional support for patients and families.

philosophy.quote: The goal of hospice care is not to hasten death, but to make the time remaining as meaningful and comfortable as possible.

decision.title: The Decision-Making Process
decision.description: Making the decision to begin hospice care is a collaborative process involving patients, families, and healthcare providers. This is a medical care decision that honors patient wishes and family values.

collaboration.title: Collaborative Discussion
collaboration.description: Patients, family members, and healthcare providers work together to make the hospice care decision based on medical condition and personal values.

wishes.title: Honoring Patient Wishes
wishes.description: If the patient can clearly communicate, the hospice team develops a care plan that respects and honors the patient's personal wishes and preferences.

support.title: Family Support
support.description: When patients cannot make decisions, designated family members or healthcare proxies make medical decisions with guidance from our team.

patient.title: Patient Communication
patient.description: When patients can clearly communicate, they direct their own care plan and make informed decisions about their treatment preferences.

family.title: Family Designation
family.description: Patients can designate trusted family members or healthcare proxies to make medical decisions when they are unable to communicate.

hierarchy.title: Decision Hierarchy
hierarchy.description: Typically follows spouse first, then adult children, following legal guidelines and respecting family dynamics.

guidance.title: Professional Guidance
guidance.description: Our team provides expert guidance and support throughout the decision-making process, ensuring informed choices.

eligibility.title: Eligibility & Assessment Process
eligibility.description: Understanding when hospice care is appropriate and how the assessment process works to ensure patients receive the right level of care at the right time.

prognosis.title: Terminal Prognosis
prognosis.description: Physicians determine if a patient has a terminal prognosis of six months or less if the disease runs its normal course.

decline.title: Functional Decline
decline.description: Evidence of declining functional status and progression of the terminal illness, indicating the need for comfort-focused care.

comfort.title: Comfort Care Focus
comfort.description: Patient and family choose to focus on comfort, quality of life, and symptom management rather than curative treatments.

assessment.title: Assessment Process

steps.consultation: Initial consultation with patient, family, and current healthcare team
steps.medical: Comprehensive medical review and physician certification of eligibility
steps.team: Interdisciplinary team assessment of patient needs and care requirements
steps.plan: Development of personalized care plan focusing on comfort and quality of life

assessment.note: Our team works closely with your existing healthcare providers to ensure a smooth transition to hospice care.

benefits.title: Benefits of Hospice Care
benefits.description: The benefits of hospice care extend beyond medical treatment, providing comprehensive support that brings strength to patients and their caregivers during this important time.

emotional.title: Emotional Support
emotional.description: Comprehensive grief counseling, spiritual care, and emotional support for both patients and family members throughout the journey.

family.title: Family Support
family.description: Family education, respite care, and bereavement services that continue for 13 months after your loved one's passing.

practical.title: Practical Planning
practical.description: 24/7 on-call support, medical equipment, medications, and professional care services all covered by insurance.

comfort.title: Comfort and Peace
comfort.description: Prioritizing pain relief and symptom management to ensure maximum comfort and quality of life.

control.title: Personal Control
control.description: Respecting patient autonomy and personal choices in their care decisions.

legal.title: Legal Clarity
legal.description: Clear understanding of healthcare directives and legal aspects of end-of-life care.

cta.title: Ready to Learn More?
cta.description: Our compassionate team is here to answer your questions and help you understand if hospice care is right for your family. There's no obligation to start care.

cta.title: Ready to Learn More

faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqSection.description: Get answers to common questions about hospice care, our services, and how we can support you and your loved ones during this important time.

payment.question: How is hospice care paid for?
payment.answer: Most hospice care is covered by Medicare, Medicaid, and private insurance. We work directly with insurance providers to minimize out-of-pocket expenses for families. Our admissions team will verify your benefits and explain any potential costs upfront.

eligibility.question: Who is eligible for hospice care?
eligibility.answer: Hospice care is available for individuals with a life-limiting illness and a prognosis of six months or less if the disease runs its normal course. Common conditions include cancer, heart disease, dementia, respiratory conditions, and stroke complications.

location.question: Where is hospice care provided?
location.answer: Hospice care can be provided wherever the patient calls home - whether that's their own residence, a family member's home, assisted living facility, or nursing home. We also have inpatient facilities for situations requiring more intensive medical management.

services.question: What services are included in hospice care?
services.answer: Our comprehensive hospice services include pain and symptom management, nursing care, personal care assistance, social work support, spiritual care, medical equipment and supplies, medications related to the hospice diagnosis, and bereavement support for families.

family.question: How does hospice support family members?
family.answer: We provide extensive support to family members including education about caregiving, emotional and spiritual support, respite care to give family caregivers a break, and bereavement counseling that continues for up to 13 months after the loss of a loved one.

timing.question: When is the right time to consider hospice care?
timing.answer: The earlier hospice care begins, the more benefit patients and families receive. Consider hospice when curative treatments are no longer effective or desired, when comfort becomes the primary goal, or when frequent hospitalizations occur. It's never too early to have the conversation.

team.question: Who is part of the hospice care team?
team.answer: Our interdisciplinary team includes physicians, nurses, home health aides, social workers, chaplains, volunteers, and other specialists as needed. Each team member brings unique expertise to ensure comprehensive, compassionate care for both patients and families.

quality.question: How do you ensure quality of life?
quality.answer: We focus on managing pain and symptoms effectively, supporting emotional and spiritual needs, maintaining dignity and independence as much as possible, and helping patients engage in meaningful activities and relationships. Quality of life is at the heart of everything we do.
